Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: Hello again. It is 4 am and I am up with many thoughts. I have to find peace. I have bone mets, triple negative. I break down and cry and say " I don't understand"? I am almost 49, I thought I was young before the cancer struck April last year. I am not "giving up", however I wonder if any of you believe your cancer is part of God's plan for you. I am not a Chistian, however I do believe in God. When I focus on trusting Him, I think maybe this stage IV journey is all part of His plan for me. Anyone feel like this? Hugs, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Does God have a plan for me? Renae64 Kaelia

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2013 12:26PM Renae64 wrote: Thanks for your reply. Mets confirmed Nov 1st 2012 after I had trouble walking, horrible. I will try noy to worry, it is controlled at the moment. Renae xx
Posts.Title: Does God have a plan for me? Renae64 Kaelia

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2013 04:12PM Renae64 wrote: I am 218 I think?
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: Just wondering if anyone has had any success with a weekly support group? It seems like it is a hard thing to find so maybe I'll simply stay online. I was going to try a 6 week program but was told tonight that I was too early in my dx so I should not attend. So much for trying to create a network of support, I did feel rather duped and dumped. :-( Since I met the women once, they will wonder where I am this week. Oh well, I am thankful for this online support group. We all benefit and no one is left out. Hugs again, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Support Groups Renae64 exbrnxgrl

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: Just curious, has anyone ever considered Dignitas? I know it is a legal option for a peaceful passing in Switzerland. Oregon, Washington and Montana have legal options for residents of those states. I know it is a very personal decision to consider and many would never "go there". The option, however may offer some level of comfort and control over uncertainty if the chemo doesn't work and hospice is the next step. Hugs, Renae Ps, I hope my question is not too confronting, Stage 4 is a tricky place to be. Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Sensitive question... Renae64 MartyMart

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2013 07:04AM Renae64 wrote: Thank you, I know I must be strong. I am going to try harder, so many beautiful young women. We are young, I hold you all in my heart. Hugs and love to all, Renae
Posts.Title: Guilt Renae64 K-Lo

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: My 4am mind is awake again with thoughts, this time with the memory of times I chose (my husbsnd was not interested) to not have children. Now that I am in this stage of cancer, "regrets" are coming out of the closet. It is too late. Breast cancer has been linked with childlessness. Asking the question, any of you dear women without children? Hugs, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: No children Renae64 Renae64

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: I feel like I screwed up. I took the pill at the ages 46-48, bc found just before 48th bday. My breasts felt different during the time I was on the pill, firm. I ignored this feeling. I feel like I was careless, I never thought I would be get bc! I am paying for this mistake with my life! God help me. Hugs, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Guilt Renae64 K-Lo

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2013 11:31PM Renae64 wrote: I don't want to think about it, I just know that it is available in some countries. Australia does not have any legal options for those who want to end their lives when needed. Don't worry, I am hanging out the laundry in the sunshine. It is simple pleasure, one that I enjoy. Warmth from Renae
Posts.Title: Sensitive question... Renae64 MartyMart

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: Here is one for us. I went to Think Pink Living Centre in Melbourne, Australia today for a complimentary massage. My husband found out about it, well there is no such thing as a free massage like a free lunch. The breast care nurse who is managing it basically told me that they don't mix secondary women with those who are not, stage 1, 2, 3. in their meetings. They keep them apart since it can be too hard for those women who fears are what we have all been dealt. Hmm, pink is not for everyone. I don't know what to do, this place is for all women "living with bc". I met the founder and she seemed nice. I got mixed messages from this place. Maybe I should be posting this on the Australian Sisters section. I am American, living here for 21 years, just curious has anyone been made to feel uncomfortable in such a way. Hugs, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pink is not for every woman Renae64 SPAMgirl

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: Maybe I have missed something but is there a way to go to Stage IV for TNBC only. The TN topic is very broad once you have mets. Thank you! Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Only Renae64 11tyBillion

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: Hi again, I continue to ask myself, why did I get cancer? I have some ideas like why the hell did I take the pill at the age of 45?!? ( I am very good at beating myself up. ) But then I know many of you dear women did not take the pill. Is it stress? Defective genes? Family history? Dense breasts? No children, etc .? Just asking the question, why do you think you got breast cancer? Huge, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Why, why, why....?! Renae64

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: I am considering Xeloda but reluctant. I had hand and foot while on AC and currently dealing with neuropathy from taxotere. Can those who have taken Xeloda please comment honestly. Hugs, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Xeloda, hand and foot syndrome Renae64 Chickadee

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2013 08:11PM Renae64 wrote: Hello from Melbourne, I am so sorry to hear of your recurrence. May I ask your age? I am turning 49, you sound like you might be close to my age? We are all too young. I thought I would grow old, this crappy cancer has made me old. My parents are in Chicago, I don't know if they really understand my future. I think we TN need so much support. I am scared too, they tell us 2-4 years to live. What do we do with that knowledge? Write me anytime. Love, Renae

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: Here is another bad example of pink sisterhood. My early bc stage pink sister was all over me before I became Stage IV. Flowers, gifts, etc. Now, hardly nothing. And she is made bc her new career, so I know she is supposed to be there for everyone. I think I make her too sad or something although I have been nothing less than cheerful since when I have seen her. Btw, she met with Olivia Newton John! Think pink, I say it stinks. Hugs, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Triple Negative Stage IV Renae64 thrivingmama

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2014 12:16AM Renae64 wrote: Faith, I am so very sorry to hear about what has happened to you. Breast cancer is a horrible disease that you do not deserve! Anger is natural, you do not need to feel guilty. Does your fiancé understand? I sometimes think we get more upset when we not expressing ourselves to the right people. Those closest to us are not always the ones to talk to. We are always here for you, vent and scream away. What you have been through is more than horrible. Holding you in my heart. And yes, try to do fun things to keep your mind in the moment, things that make you feel good. Hugs, Renae

Posts.Title: Triple Negative Stage IV Renae64 thrivingmama

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: I cannot bear thinking about the pain of the loss of the time I won't have with my husband, it hurts and makes me cry. I know it is not happening now, but I still feel grief. It is worse because you know it going to happen. Everything is bittersweet. Anyone have any tips about dealing with these emotions. Hugs and tears, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Bad scan. Need prayers Evans1128 Cafelovr

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: I just had a nice time tonight listening to an outdoor music concert. The thing is I feel like if I didn't wake up tomorrow, I would be okay. I appreciate life and all the beauty I see, however it hurts. I feel so much. Stage IV is crap, I don't want to battle on. I would much rather just get it over with or somehow forget, it is the constant monkey on my back. I don't know if I am alone with these thoughts. The women who post are so strong, so amazing. Just when I want to forget I have cancer, I remember I can never forget. I feel weak but I know strength of mind is the only thing that will keep me here. Everyday, up and down. It is all so much, cancer sucks, I long for peace. How does one "live" with Stage IV without going nuts. I love all of you. We must be special to have survived this cruel disease day to day. Thanking you, beautiful women. Hugs, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scared, sad, confused, alone? Renae64 M-Aug

Posts.Content: Renae64 wrote: Was anyone on the bcp when cancer was found. I really need to know, there must some ladies Hugs, Renae Dx 4/3/2012, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/24/2012 Lumpectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Birth Contol Pill Renae64 Chris59

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2013 04:39PM Renae64 wrote: Thank you for your understanding, compassion. It means a lot to me. I don't know what I would do without your loving posts. I do need to find a professional to talk to. It must be someone I feel really comfortable with and who I can completely trust. Hugs. Renae (I am not alone)
Posts.Title: Scared, sad, confused, alone? Renae64 M-Aug
